author: Joanne Chiu
title: Trump Cancels North Korea Summit, but Impact on Asian Stocks Is Muted—for Now
text:
Stocks in Asia weakened Friday following President Donald Trump’s sudden cancellation of a June summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. Still, investors’ worries about the scrapped meeting were softened by expectations that the two countries could continue their dialogue. South Korea’s Kospi trimmed an early 0.5% loss to fall just 0.1%, while major benchmarks in Hong Kong, mainland China and Japan were all down less than 0.5%. Two major Southeast Asian markets, Indonesia and Malaysia, bucked that trend, with the latter rebounding 1% after two days of big declines.
